meanings.definition: A feeling of agitation or anxiety.
meanings.sent1: The loud noise gave me agita.
meanings.sent2: She always gets agita before a big test.
meanings.sent3: His constant fidgeting gave him a case of agita.
meanings.sent4: The looming deadline caused a wave of agita in the office.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds overhead filled him with agita.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to feel agitated or anxious.
meanings.sent1: Please don't agita the dog with loud noises.
meanings.sent2: The suspenseful movie really agita me.
meanings.sent3: His teasing remarks tend to agita his sister.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected news agita the entire family.
meanings.sent5: The constant honking of car horns agita the neighborhood residents.
